gaia.description: GAIA (Generative AI is Awesome) is an open-source framework for running generative AI applications on AMD hardware

backend.description: Uses ONNX Runtime GenAI (OGA) via Lemonade for LLM execution

lemonade.description: Multi-vendor open-source SDK for LLM deployment
interfaces: OGA APIs for C++ and Python
features: Quick experimentation with hybrid execution mode
Validation of inference speed and task performance
High-level API integration for Python apps

oga.role: Provides LLM interface for execution backends like Ryzen AI

hybrid.description: Utilizes both NPU and iGPU on Ryzen AI systems
features: Optimal model partitioning between NPU and iGPU
Compute-intensive operations offloaded exclusively to NPU

modes.generic: Runs on non-Ryzen AI systems using standard GPU acceleration

raux.description: AMD's beta UI for AI model interaction
raux.integration: Installed separately but can be managed through GAIA installer
